Reviews.Title: Everything I Could Want
Reviews.Author: S. Carlson
Reviews.Content: In preparation for a trip to Europe last August I was looking for a new camera. As we were planning on a lot of walking and packing very light, I wanted a pocket-sized camera. No way was I taking my old Pentax film SLR camera on this trip!There are many cameras out there that are similar in size and features to the Kodak M763, but most are more money. I have a general policy of not spending more than I have to for electronics, as whatever I buy will be obselete in a few years (witness my previous digital camera, only two and a half years old and positively outclassed by the M763 for only $10 more).I purchased this camera, and was VERY pleased with the pictures I took. It did everything I asked and expected from a pocket camera. Excellent clarity outdoors, with enough zoom capability to allow proper framing of the picture without having to move a great deal. Excellent low-light performance indoors allowing pictures in many circumstances without flash, which avoids the washed-out faces against a black background so common in flash pictures. Face recognition and image stabilization worked well, allowing quality pictures in light conditions I never expected to work.All in all I was extremely happy with my pictures and the ease of use of the Kodak M763, and never felt like I was missing out on features of more expensive cameras. I would heartily recommend it to anyone looking for a pocket snapshot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera easy to learn and use since this is my first digital.  Followed Consumer Reports recommedations and am very pleased with quality and ease of picture taking.  Easy on the pocketbook, too.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Kenzie
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera!!!!!!! I bought it for a trip to disney world in June and I have taken over 500 pictures with it already. My mom has a Canon Power Shot that she payed over $300 for and whenever she wants good pics she asks if she can borrow my camera. She is going to buy one as soon as the economy gets a little better.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Jack
Reviews.Content: I just got back from vacation and downloaded my pictures and I have to say that the pics came out really good. There were a few that were dark but I did take them in the late afternoon when the natural lighting has just about gone. I think that for the price of this camera it is an acceptable limit for the camera. I think it is a great camera and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great product - small package
Reviews.Author: H. Bennett
Reviews.Content: this tiny device has so many great funcitons packed into it.  the photos are great quality of course, but I was pleasantly surprised by the video.  you can take any video frame and create a still photo from it - and one would expect those photos to be mediocre, but they're great too!  I gave it as a gift to a friend who never reads owner's manuals, and he has all but mastered every function within a week of receiving it.

Reviews.Title: Great Price for little Camera
Reviews.Author: Juvette C. Clark
Reviews.Content: Great Price for little camera. Takes beautiful pictures only if there is great light. If there is little light, you have to guess on the shot because the LCD screen does not allow you to see the view very much at all. Zoom is great as long as you don't zoom in more than 3x...grainy. When you take pictures in bright sunl1ight there is a mirror glare. I am in the process of paying a few extra dollars for a camera that would better fit my needs. I wouldn't purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Simple and versatile
Reviews.Author: K. Nichols "Computer nerd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when we lost our old Kodak 2.4MP camera that we had had for over 3 years. I've had it a bit over a month, and have used it for a variety of situations, indoor and out. I have found it to be very easy to use. It has almost no lag, and can take pictures within a couple seconds of each other. The auto setting does a good job in just about every normal situation, but it has a large amount of custom settings if you need it.  It's lightweight, small, and you hardly notice it hanging from your wrist.  The battery lasts over two hours with almost continuous use.  However, it has a customizable power-saver feature that turns off the camera if you haven't used it for awhile.It has a movie-taking option, but I haven't used that yet.This camera does everything I need it to do.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice basic point-and-shoot...until it breaks...and breaks again.
Reviews.Author: Larry Stillman
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera for my 13 yr-old daughter.  She really liked it.  9 months after purchase, it would turn on, then immediately off.  The warranty covered it.  9 months after the repair, the same malfunction reoccurred, now out of warranty.  I spoke with customer service to discuss cost.  $70, or a 15% discount towards a new one.  I told him, point blank, no thanks, it's time for Canon.On a side note, I took a Colorado River raft trip in 1989, shooting Kodak slide film from the boat.  I'd shot slides for years, almost all Kodak, and used their pre-paid mailers for developing.  One of these precious river rolls was somehow developed concurrently with someone else's slide roll, essentially double exposing mine and theirs, ruining the roll.  I wrote Kodak, just looking for the barest apology, maybe a free roll, but received nothing.  I never shot Kodak again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Yas
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift and I must say I love it!  It replaced the Olympus Camedia that I had before.  There is no comparison between the two, this is sleek and sexy (if a camera can be sexy).  The camera is easy to use, and very user friendly.  The zoom focus, the face detector, the video mode are all great features.  I have taken over 500 pics with it thus far and thousands more to go.  :)

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves this little camera
Reviews.Author: Becky "Becky"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my daughter for Christmas. Very easy to use as is the software from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M763
Reviews.Author: Judy Dragon, Co-editor and writer for "Mu...
Reviews.Content: It's easy to use but the dial to set the modes is hard to read...too small. It's lightweight, easily viewable screen unless you're in the sun where there is a glare present. Rechargeable battery is a nice feature and lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: Highly unreliable
Reviews.Author: Martin Johncox
Reviews.Content: This camera worked well for a couple of years. Now, for some unexplained reason, it won't stay on. The lens extends and the welcome screen comes on and then it just shuts down in a few seconds. It's a common problem if you Google it. I tried some of the fixes that worked for others but it's still not working. What a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Sure it would be ok
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If the screen came on. And if it cane with a battery,  charger,  or manual. After buying a battery and charger separately,  I have found that the screen on mine doesn't even turn on. There is a sound and the little green light comes on (sometimes it's orange) when the power button is pressed but that's all. I've contacted the seller about this and hopefully it'll be resolved soon.Update: I received a response stating that it was posted as untested and unguaranteed to function properly. Extremely dissatisfied with my purchase and would like to file a complaint with amazon if possible.

Reviews.Title: Love Kodak
Reviews.Author: DEBRA ADAMS
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kodak camera.  I am now on my 5th, and am so dissapointed that Kodak stopped making cameras!

Reviews.Title: arrrrgh!
Reviews.Author: original
Reviews.Content: i received this donkey ccamera as a replacement gift.  My previous camera was also a low-life kodak too....Anyway, i do not caare for this camera.  well, i honestly hate it.  First the positives:  easy to use (just monkey around with it, and you will get it even if you are a tech-dummy like me) and is lightweight portable.  Now the negatives:  very slow to snap pictures if you shake much (even with the image stabilizer), really needs light to work well (awful for indoor shooting), picture quality is horrible, video is quite sub-par.  I am no techie and cannot go into further details, but I like good quality photos.  This camera does not do it for me at all.  I was given kodak as gift and i only use it to take pictures to sell at ebay.  This camera even gives me a hard time doing that!!!  I have to snap 3-5 times for one picture to come out 'decent' as I am fussy how a picture will look like---if you are ebay seller you know pics make the difference in how well your product will sell.I plan to get a upscale camera sometime this year with my saved up sb.  I have a lovely cat and would love to take pics of her.  So yes, I am looking for a good P+S camera like samsung tl500 or lumix lx series.  I have been so disappointed with this camera that i think even mid-range cameras  wont suit me.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for almost two years now and I LOVE it! It is very portable, reasonably priced, and simple to use. My husband usually uses the automatic setting, I usually use the more specialized settings, and we both have gotten some great pictures. Of course, they aren't going to be as great as those taken by an expensive "professional" camera, but for a simple point-and-shoot, I've gotten some fantastic pictures!  It did "forget the date" once and was dating some of my pictures for Nov. 2030. Once I realized it, though, it was an easy fix. No big deal. Sadly, it is now broken--after my 15 mo. old son got a hold of it and threw it on the ground repeatedly...  I am looking to buy another Kodak, since I was so pleased with this one. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but slow camera
Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for a long time now and we are happy with it. It takes great pictures, its easy to use and has just enough picture settings to be handybut not over do it. but boy it can be slow to process the picture you just took, maybe to slow for some, as the next shot is lost because you are waiting for the last shot to be saved. This is not my Canon DSLR but if you dont mind the wait the pictures it takes are very nice.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M763 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kc C "."
Reviews.Content: Camera is perfect for everything.  Size of camera...can fit in a pocket, small purse or on a belt with the correct carrying case.Easy to use with pictures that are greatI've put away my bigger and more expensive cameras for this one that can always be so handy.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I ever bought!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased this camera about 4 years ago (for a lower price than listed). Since then, I've loved this camera.  It's super easy to use and takes great quality shots.  I recently made a trip to Monterey, CA and have postcard quality pics to remember it by.  Even inside a dimly lit aquarium I managed to get beautiful shots.  I appreciate the fact that it "rates" my shots via a small hand-like icon, based on clarity.  Green for good, yellow for fair and red for poor. All in all, it's a great buy.  And to all the reviewers who can't understand what we're raving about...you probably just got a dud.  It's been known to happen.

Reviews.Title: good bu
Reviews.Author: O. Godoy "Maniac325i"
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera, bonus is the rechargeable battery, multi-targeting when shooting. Good pictures for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use, But very basic
Reviews.Author: Victor F. Mayoli "BonVivant"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mom. Who is not a tech wizard and she loves it. It works well and is really easy for her to understand.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Scott M in SC
Reviews.Content: I got this as a refurbished purchase from Kodak as a replacement and use it primarily to take pictures of my two young kids.  I've had it over a year now and have had very few issues with it.  It's size is great when I'm out with the kids b/c I'm usually carrying enough stuff and don't need a bulky camera added to the mix!  It works great in a variety of lighting and takes wonderful pictures and outstanding video (my ex-wife has the video camera and this takes such good video that I don't have a need for the "real" video camera).  It can sometimes be a little slow to activate when initially turned on and sometimes (rarely) has a hard time focusing, but whether photographing scenery or the kids, all in all I've loved it and it's been easy enough to use that my 6yo daughter can take decent pictures with it as well!  The only other negative is that the screen can be hard, even impossible, to use in bright sunlight, but it's easy enough to point and shoot and generally get good results.

Reviews.Title: Compact but unreliable
Reviews.Author: Jodie Quinn
Reviews.Content: I want to like this camera, but it seems everytime I want some important photos, it goes blurry. have taken some very good pictures, but never know when it will go bad again. I have tried different settings, but normally use auto. I have also tried different memory cards (trying anything). Emails to Kodak tech support were useless.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Frances Cooper "soggypaw"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to keep in my purse for opportunity photos. It delivers clear pictures and I love the facial recognition feature. The zoom is great for a small point and shoot camera. Within it's category it is a great find. Thumbs up Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera -- great price
Reviews.Author: Sims Gamer "Sims2Sandra"
Reviews.Content: this camera was everything I expected and really nice to use...  really easy controls.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera for my little sister as a Christmas gift, and she absolutely loves it! It's small and compact and takes great pictures...she's already used it for a school project. the setup was easy and straightforward. The kodak software included installed with out any problems as well.

Reviews.Title: Easy Camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B. Adams "pcolabch123"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my parents for Xmas...they didn't have a digital camera so i tried this one out and they love how easy it is to take pictures and download them on your computer! this is a great camera for the young and old! And it's soooooo lightweight i couldn't believe it and takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Vanella
Reviews.Content: It was very quick and easy to order this item.  The delivery was very prompt.  The camera is great !

Reviews.Title: It's good only for a couple of months
Reviews.Author: Yue Xu
Reviews.Content: My M763 was good only for two months and then both the LCD creeen and the pictures taken turned pinkish whenever the temperature was high (ove 80C). I had to cool the camera down to get rid of the pink color. Now the pink color stays forever.Obviously a bad quality camera.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite little camera.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Garza
Reviews.Content: I own 3 of these little Kodak m763,  This little camera has been everywhere and take great pictures. Even to Paris France what a Kodak moment. Its all good.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera!  My daughter and 2 of her friends have this camera and they all have the same problem.  Started happening just after the warranty was over for all three cameras.  $60 to repair from Kodak plus shipping.  Look at a Canon product!

Reviews.Title: Works perfect.
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Shanley "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this item for 130$ at a local electronics store.Let me start of by saying that the camera itself looks great, so great that its deceptive. Kodak easily stole a page out of Canon's book with the overall look and design. However, they failed to match the picture quality, even the video format.The camera says it will deliver digital photos with up to 7.2 mp resolution, but the pictures I shot had quality comparable to my old 5mp camera. If you're looking for razor sharp images, this is not the camera for you.The buttons on this camera pretty awkward. There is a wheel on the top of camera that you must carefully turn in order to change from photo mode to video mode. But there about 8 options on the wheel you have to be very careful or else you'll easily end up in the wrong mode. The push buttons on the camera are at surface level, they're not slightly elevated for easy access, this makes the buttons hard to feel and even tougher to push.My biggest problem with this camera, however, is the FACT that it only shoot video in Quicktime format. This is terribly disappointing, because Quicktime files cannot be edited or played on Windows Media Player, and you have to go out and purchase extra Quicktime software if you want to do anything with the videos.Personally the photo quality wasn't too big of a deal, and I could get used to the buttons. Its because of the Quicktime video format that I seriously dislike this camera and won't keep it. I could have bought a much better camera for 130$ The look is what got me, and Kodak never mentions Quicktime in their ads, so I was completely fooled when I bought this camera.130$ wasted, I swear to never buy another Kodak product for the rest of my life. Buy Canon instead, the Canon Powershot is great, perhaps I'll buy one of them.I'm re-gifting my camera and giving it to a very VERY distant relative for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Bad Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Michail Chourdakis
Reviews.Content: Let me first say I am suprised that 12 out of 13 reviewers find this camera good, and let me also say I don't usually rate 1/5 most products I buy. This camera is really an exception.Before I write this review I sent the camera back to the service to replace it, because I was sure that the specific piece was faulty.Not only they didn't fix anything, they just returned it claiming that it was "calibrated". The images taken are full of blur , visible by naked eye. Printing or viewing @ TV is also bad.I am staying away from Kodak next time.

Reviews.Title: This camera blows
Reviews.Author: Master B
Reviews.Content: Ok, I don't know what is wrong with people who rate this camera so well.  It's problems started right upon purchase (which I bought for a trip to europe - seems everyone is going there these days).  First of all, it regularly "forgets" the date and time.  Ok, no big deal, just reset it every time I turn it on.  The real problem(s) that I've had with it are its lack of focus.  It NEVER focuses!  EVERYTHING is blurry!!! When it is really really really sunny, the picture is in focus, but when light levels dip to normal levels, nothing is in focus, ever.  Second, the "optical stabilization" doesn't do anything.  I don't have shaky hands and have taken lots of photos in the past, I'm no "expert", but I can hold a camera steady.  Turns out, not steady enough for focus to be maintained.  Finally, it has been falling apart like nobody's business.  The shutter over the lens broke, the screen somehow has lint built up behind the glass, and autofocus doesn't even pretend to try to focus anymore (though it used to try and fail).  Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: Spend $20 more dollars for a better camera
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGal
Reviews.Content: I actually got this camera b/c Target had 2 broken versions of the camera I wanted that I had already returned and this is all they had. So I took it b/c I was tired of returning to Target.The picture quality with low light is very bad. The flash is horrible compared to my old Sony. And, I've had the camera for only 2 months and the screen is horribly scratched from very little use. And there are somehow little dots inside the screen as well? Don't even know how those got there.For $20 more I could have gotten a small compact Sony, which is what I plan to do after selling this one on ebay or at the local electronic store for parts.

Reviews.Title: Great but no memory incuded
Reviews.Author: MD Kirk "MD Kirk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 13 year old daughter.  She likes it, but I'm glad I bought extra memory for the camera; otherwise Santa would have been in big trouble on Christmas Day morning.  I expected it to come with a memory card with little memory on it, typically, just enough to use the camera out of the box.  I was shocked that the camera does not come with a memory chip (am I just out of the loop?), therefore being unusable unless you buy a chip separately.  No wonder they can sell these cameras for ~$[]....Also, Blue to Kodak is more Black than Blue.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M763
Reviews.Author: John P. Francis
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kodak M763 I've owned. The first was misplaced in Amsterdam... Anyways, I enjoy all Kodak products. I've always been a Kodak fan...

Reviews.Title: OK, but certainly not great
Reviews.Author: D. Updike "Dutchman"
Reviews.Content: I thought the description stated like new and in the box.  I was disappointed wwhen it arrived with scratches on the view screen.  It arrived in a timely manner and fuctions well.  But it wasn't "like new".

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Albert L. Fowlkes "ALF"
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable! You would think that if you ordered a camera with a rechargeable battery in it, it would ship with the charger.  But wait!  You have to order one separately and nowhere does it tell you that in the order process or online descriptions. You have to wait until you have the user manual in hand (and a dead battery)  So at the very least I had to pay for additional shipping where, if they had indicated that it was a REQUIRED accessory,  I could have included it in the original shipment.

Reviews.Title: Sold non-functioning Camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Martinez
Reviews.Content: The camera would not work and then I realized it was because the battery was not charging.  When I contacted the seller, they told me the battery did not work and that I had to buy a new one.Why sell me a camera with a non-functioning battery?  They could have simply written in the description that a new battery would need to be bought.  I would have never purchased it!

Reviews.Title: stay  away  from  Kodak  bad  picture  quality
Reviews.Author: Linda D. Thames "linda d. thames"
Reviews.Content: i  bought  this  camera  1  week  ago  after  i  had  to  take  the  Kodak m863  back  to kmart  and  i  printed  some  pictures  from  the  printer  and  the  were  very  cloudy  and  the  had  big  lines  in  them so  i  took  the  camera  back  to  kmart  and  got  my  money  back  and the  camera  had  dots  all  over the  screen.  i  said  to  my  self  i am  never  buying  a  Kodak  again.

Reviews.Title: i want purchase DVD player and Laptop
Reviews.Author: V. Kannan
Reviews.Content: i want purchase DVD PLAYER and Laptop for 12 month finance systemif i order the above item when can i get.because i am leaving from Houston 19-08-2008 Tuesday (i am from india)please sent the detail or the same system available in indiaragardskannan

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jane B. Stark
Reviews.Content: hi i loved this camera!! thnaks but im just wondering was it new or used????

ProductInfo.Features:
7.2-megapixel resolution for high-quality prints up to 20 x 30 inches
3x optical zoom, 5x digital zoom
Face detection technology; HD picture capture
Kodak Perfect Touch technology
16 MB built-in memory; compatible with SD cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M763 7.2 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom (Red)
